intro: Senecio choiquelaunensis, commonly known as the Choique Desert Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of hair, helping to reduce water loss. Senecio choiquelaunensis produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
